div.p: Greetings. I was completely horrified (reverend father in Christ) when I read the actions of that old man. Where will the poor old man turn? But I do not doubt that there were just causes for such a severe reprimand. I do not have the Dialogues, I saw them only once and no more. Others ask me whether he is suspected of Arianism; I cannot even respond with a word and yet I would like to know; for without a doubt he will turn to us. However, if he favored the Arians, he should not be received at all. Not a word about the council for the time being. I believed it would be dissolved, especially since everyone affirmed it so unanimously and consistently. But soon we will hear something certain. I will take care of your letters to Count Martinengo; in them, I thought it necessary to inform you that Clavenna is not in Valtellina; it is a separate county.

Cl√§ffner wine and Veltliner are not the same. And so that I come to the wine through this, know that here in the summer the old Veltliner was at a very reasonable price, because everyone expected that the new one would be plentiful and good. Now they are both at a higher price, as the new one is not at its best. And as Balingketus here, with whom I discussed these matters, was of my opinion, there has not yet come a truly good Veltliner; for what comes now is sweetened and adulterated. The foreign merchants need this; for in Germany, people like to drink something sweet, therefore they pay for it now; for everyone wants to be the first with the sweet one. And if 20 loads of sweet come, one can hardly find 1 load of genuine and natural. Therefore, I advise you to wait quietly until St. Paul's Day; I hope to provide for you well, if God lets us live, unless I come across a good one in the meantime. This one is not for you, it causes much fluid in the head and unrest in the body.
Let me know what you want to be done about it; I will not fail, but I advise you to wait until St. Paul's Day.
A good Veltliner can lie for a hundred years, and we drink such. A sweetened one would not last longer than until around Carnival and then it becomes like a sour broth, etc.
I return the letters from Heidelberg and thank you. If the plague passes us by, it is a wonder. But let the Lord's will be done.
It has also appeared in Maienfeld and cleared 2 houses, so I hear, and it has not gone further yet.
I will soon send all the acts of the Pellizari from beginning to end, as they are to be presented in the communities. November 29, 1563.
